[{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"NewsArticle","name":"Mothers Day 2017: 5 poems to write inside a Mother's Day card","image":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https://metro.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/ad_236382418.jpg?quality=90&strip=all","width":1024,"height":1024},"url":"https://metro.co.uk/2017/03/02/mothering-sunday-2017-5-poems-and-quotes-to-write-inside-a-mothers-day-card-6471052/","datePublished":"2017-03-02T07:00:06+00:00","dateModified":"2019-12-12T09:35:55+0000","headline":"Mothers Day 2017: 5 poems to write inside a Mother's Day card","articleBody":"Something to share (Picture: Getty images)
Sometimes a message just isn’t enough.
Poems can beoverlooked when searching for the perfect quote or message to put inside aMother’s Day card.
Mothers Day 2017: When is Mothering Sunday and why does the date change?
But when trying to show your appreciation, words with a little more punch can be the best way to show you care.
Mother’s Day is only a few weeks away – so if you haven’t already picked out a card, you’d better get cracking.
In the meantime, here are five beautiful poems to use inside a card.

MORE: Grandmother accidentally sent very rude birthday card to grandson
Heart-shaped cherry cake with name tag and flowers on tray (Picture: Getty images)
1) Mommy I Love You
Mommy, I love you
For all that you do.
I’ll kiss you and hug you
‘Cause you love me, too.
You feed me and need me
To teach you to play,
So smile ’cause I love you
On this Mother’s Day.
Nicholas Gordon
2) My Mother
My mother is so sweet
Sweeter than all sweets you eat’
She is gentle and kind
and works by using her mind.
Her ears are sharp like a knife
and she is a perfect wife.
If someone is in need, oh dear
My sweet mother is always there.
Hena Dhawan
3) God’s Gift
My Mother is a special gift,
A special gift that God gave to me.
I’d be lost and lonely without her,
If God took her away you see.
I love her so very much,
That I couldn’t bear to live without her healing touch.
Thank-you God for giving me such a loving Mother,
For I wouldn’t want to be a part of no other.
Melanie Reid
4)Thank God for our Mothers
If life were without water, where would we be?
If life were without mothers,
There would be no you or me.
We all need to take hold, of how precious life really is,
and not take for granted the gift of love and the ability to give.
Thank you to God for creating us all
For giving us our mothers
So we can stand proud and tall.
Humans are no accident, no mistake or error
We sometimes live our lives in fear of this,
Even to the point of terror.
But when the truth is told, and recognised by all,
God does not create rubbish. He knew what he was doing when he created
me and you, but the best gift of all, is giving us loving, caring
Mothers who love us unconditionally through and through.
None of us are perfect, that includes ourselves and family.
Hold onto how precious we are and thank God for our mothers.
Amen
Julia Hunt
5)I Love You Mother
I Love You Mother
You are so special and kind
And I love you so
You helped to build my mind
And I want you to know.
The thought of you by me
Just makes me smile.
We are so close
Forever and not just a while.
I appreciate you mother
And I love all your style.
Nicole Ruddock
17 quotes to write inside a card
(Picture: Getty)
1) ‘As mothers and daughters, we are connected with one another. My mother is the bones of my spine, keeping me straight and true. She is my blood, making sure it runs rich and strong. She is the beating of my heart. I cannot now imagine a life without her.’Kristin Hannah, Summer Island
2) ‘A mother is a person who seeing there are only four pieces of pie for five people, promptly announces she never did care for pie.’ Tenneva Jordan
3) ‘When you are a mother, you are never really alone in your thoughts. A mother always has to think twice, once for herself and once for her child.’ Sophia Loren
4) ‘Don’t poets know it better than others? God can’t always be everywhere: and, so, invented mothers.’ Sir Edwin Arnold
5) ‘A mother understands what a child does not say.’ Jewish Proverb
6) ‘Even as a small child, I understood that women had secrets, and that some of these were only to be told to daughters. In this way we were bound together for eternity.’Alice Hoffman, The Dovekeepers
7) ‘Sometimes, mothers say and do things that seem like they dont want their kids  but when you look more closely, you realise that theyre doing those kids a favour. Theyre just trying to give them a better life.’Jodi Picoult, Handle with Care
8) ‘A mother’s arms are made of tenderness and children sleep soundly in them.’ – Victor Hugo
9) ‘Mothers and their children are in a category all their own. Theres no bond so strong in the entire world. No love so instantaneous and forgiving.’Gail Tsukiyama, Dreaming Water
10) ‘Who’s a boy gonna talk to if not his mother?’ – Donald E. Westlake
11) ‘Mothers, I believe, intoxicate us. We idolise them and take them for granted. We hate them and blame them and exalt them more thoroughly than anyone else in our lives. We sift through the evidence of their love, reassure ourselves of their affection and its biological genesis. We can steal and lie and leave and they will love us.’ Megan Mayhew Bergman, Birds of a Lesser Paradise: Stories
12) ‘The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother.’ – Theodore Hesburgh
13) ‘A mothers love for her child is like nothing else in the world. It knows no law, no pity, it dates all things and crushes down remorselessly all that stands in its path.’ Agatha Christie, The Last Sance
14) ‘Mother love is the fuel that enables a normal human being to do the impossible.’ Marion C. Garretty
15) ‘Because even if the whole world was throwing rocks at you, if you had your mother at your back, youd be okay. Some deep-rooted part of you would know you were loved. That you deserved to be loved.’ Jojo Moyes, One Plus One
16) ‘A mother’s arms are more comforting than anyone else’s.’ Diana, Princess of Wales
17) ‘A mother is not a person to lean on, but a person to make leaning unnecessary.’ Dorothy Canfield Fisher

				Mother's Day: Everything you need to know			
Mother’s Day is one ofthose dates that should never be forgotten.
Facebook has introduced a cute flower emotion for Mothers Day in the US
Gifts for Mother’s Day (Picture: Getty)
When is Mother’s Day 2017?
The date changes in Britain every year. This year Mother’s Day will be on Sunday March 26.
Around the world – in the US and Europe – the date is always the second Sunday in May. This year that Sunday isMay 14.
Why does the date change every year?
(Picture:Metro Graphics/Getty/: MylesGoode)
Because the date is a Christian celebration, it is linked in with Easter Sunday.
Easter changes every year according to the lunar calendar and vernal equinox.
Mother’s Day is always three weeks before Easter Sunday, or the fourth Sundayof Lent or Laetare Sunday (Middle of lent).
What is Mothering Sunday?
Taking selfies on Mother’s Day (Picture:Getty)
At its most basic, Mothering Sunday (Mother’s Day is an Americanisation) is a day to give thanks to your mother.
While many might think theday was invented by commercial entities, it is actually a Christian celebration dating back to the 16th century.
Back then, Mothering Sunday was a chance for those who worked in servitude to go back home to seetheir families and attend the church in their home town – or ‘mother church’.
Those who did so were said to have gone ‘a mothering’ and the servants would usually pick flowers to display at this mother church as well as giving them to their families.
The day gradually disappeared untilavicar’s daughter, from Coddington, Nottinghamshire, readan article about American activist Anna Jarvis who was trying to reinstate the day in 1913.
Constance Smith went on to push for a revivial of Mothering Sunday and by 1938 it was being celebrated byBoy Scouts, Girl Guides and church parishes across the country.By the 1950s the date had been well established once again.
Why is Mother’s Day celebrated later in the US?
A card made for Mother’s Day (Picture: Getty images
Mother’s Day only started to be marked in the US in 1914 afterPresident Woodrow Wilson agreed to introduce it.
Americansocial activist Anna Jarvis (1864-1948), who was from Philadelphia, is regarded as the ‘mother of Mother’s Day’ after campaigning for many years for a date to honour mothers following the death of her own mother.
After the day was approved Jarvis becameconcerned about it becoming too commercial with greetings cards and flowers, declaring that the day should be ‘of sentiment, not profit’.","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Amy Willis"},"mainEntityOfPage":{"@type":"WebPage","@id":"https://metro.co.uk/2017/03/02/mothering-sunday-2017-5-poems-and-quotes-to-write-inside-a-mothers-day-card-6471052/"},"mentions":[{"@type":"Thing","name":"Mother's Day","sameAs":"https://metro.co.uk/tag/mothers-day/"}],"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","xpath":["/html/head/title","/html/head/meta[@name='description']/@content"]},"publisher":{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Organization","name":"Metro.co.uk","url":"https://metro.co.uk","sameAs":["https://www.facebook.com/metrouk","https://www.twitter.com/metrouk","https://uk.pinterest.com/metrouk","https://www.instagram.com/metro.co.uk"],"logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/metrouk/img/branding/metro.co.uk/m-black-share.png"}}},{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Organization","name":"Metro.co.uk","url":"https://metro.co.uk","sameAs":["https://www.facebook.com/metrouk","https://www.twitter.com/metrouk","https://uk.pinterest.com/metrouk","https://www.instagram.com/metro.co.uk"],"logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/metrouk/img/branding/metro.co.uk/m-black-share.png"}},{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"BreadcrumbList","itemListElement":[{"@type":"ListItem","position":1,"name":"Home","item":"https://metro.co.uk"},{"@type":"ListItem","position":2,"name":"Lifestyle","item":"https://metro.co.uk/lifestyle/"}]}]
